title: Cheeseburger Soup
description: A hearty, meaty, cheesy soup with ground beef, potatoes, carrots and a lot of cheese.
contents:
Contents
Full Ingredient List
Soup
Cheese Sauce

Directions
Soup
Sauce


Full Ingredient List
Soup
1 to 1.5 lb hamburger
1 small onion, chopped or 1 Tbsp of dehydrated onion flakes
1 clove garlic, minced
1/4 cup red pepper, chopped
2 cups of beef bullion
4 cups potatoes, cubed
1 cup of carrots, cubed
Cheese Sauce
2 Tbsp butter
2 Tbsp flour
2.5 cups milk
8 ounces of cheddar cheese by weight, shredded
Directions
Soup
Cook and rinse 1 lb of hamburger
Cook 1 small onion and 1/4 cup of red pepper and 1 clove of garlic in some of the leftover fat from hamburger
In pressure cooker, add
cooked hamburger,
onion, pepper, potatoes
beef bullion

Add enough liquid to cover hamburger and vegetables
Cook on high pressure for 30 minutes
Quick release of pressure
Sauce
Over medium to medium-hight heat:
Melt 2 Tbsp butter
Whisk in 2 Tbsp flour
Slowly add 2.5 cups of milk
Bring to a boil
Add 8 ounces of cheese
Stir until thoroughly mixed
Add sauce to soup, thoroughly mix, and server hot.
Source: Modified from “Taste of Home Ultimate Soup Cookbook”

title: Crosby's Baked Beans
description: Instant-Pot makes these molasses baked beans a snap.
contents:
Contents
Ingredients
Directions

Ingredients
2 cups dried navy or pea beans
1 small onion, peeled
One small apple, peeled and cored
1/3 cup brown sugar
½ cup Crosby’s Fancy Molasses
1 tsp. salt
1 ½ tsp. dried mustard
½ Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
½ tsp. freshly ground black pepper
Boiling water
Directions
Place 2 cups dried beans in the instant pot and cover with an inch of water (about 4 cups).
Secure the lid, turn the pot’s steam vent to close. On manual mode, set the timer for 20 minutes.
While the beans are cooking, combine 1/3 cup brown sugar, 1/2 cup molasses, 1 tsp salt, 1 1/2 tsp dried mustard, 1/2 Tbsp Worcestershire, and 1/2 tsp black pepper in a bowl.
Add two cups of boiling water and stir to combine.
When the timer beeps, allow the pot to depressurize for about 20 minutes, press “cancel” and then carefully turn the steam vent to open and remove the lid.
Drain the beans well and return them to the pot.
Bury 1 small onion and 1 apple in the beans and pour molasses mixture over the beans.
Secure the lid, turn the steam vent to close, and set the timer for 16 minutes.
When the 16 minutes are up (timer beeps), allow your pot to depressurize another 20 minutes, turn steam vent to open and remove lid.
If your beans are too runny, turn unit to saute mode and saute for 5-7 minutes, stirring from time to time.
From Crosby’s site: https://www.crosbys.com/instant-pot-molasses-baked-beans/

title: Spaghetti Sauce
description: A sweet and savory tomato sauce that is great on top of pasta or as part of a lasagna.
contents:
Contents
Ingredients - Full
Ingredients - Halved
Directions

v 0.0.4
The full recipe should serve 6 - 8 people, the half serves 4 - 6. I know the half seems like very little sauce, but at least in our family we always have too much.
Ingredients - Full
2 x 20oz crushed tomatoes
1/2 cup red wine
2/3 cup White sugar
2 Tbsp minced garlic
2 Tbsp minced onion
3 Tbsp basil leaves
2 Tbsp oregano flakes
2 tsp rosemary
2 tsp thyme
2 Tbsp worcestershire sauce
2 bay leaves
2 Tbsp tomato paste
Ingredients - Halved
20 oz crushed tomatoes
1/4 red wine
1/3 cup white sugar
1 Tbsp minced garlic
1 Tbsp minced onion
1 Tbsp basil leaves
1 Tbsp oregano flakes
1 tsp rosemary
1 tsp thyme
1 Tbsp Worcestershire sauce
1 Tbsp tomato paste
1 bay leaf
Directions
Combine all ingredients in a large pot, bring to a gentle simmer, reduce heat and allow to simmer for 2 hours.
Alternatively, drop 1 Tbsp of vegetable oil in pot, and over medium-high heat cook onion and garlic for 2 - 3 minutes until fragrant and browned. Combine rest of ingredients as above.
If desired, 1lb of browned ground beef can be added before serving over noodles or using in other pasta recipes.

title: Welcome to Flight Family Recipes
description: Welcome to my personal recipe site.
contents:
This is my personal recipe site. It’s organized as a blog, because that was easy to set up. I definitely recommend using the Categories on the right to navigate, or using the search bar at the top.
